segments.text: I can’t believe how calm everything looks outside that window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden is so neat and peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just tired or completely lost in thought.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I love how mischievous they’re being, but that stool is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor is getting more and more slippery, and no one seems to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a silent movie where everything is about to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the calm outside and the mess inside is almost funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off that faucet before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR
